thread.title: College Football: ONU rallies to stun No. 11 John Carroll
thread.title_full: College Football: ONU rallies to stun No. 11 John Carroll

author: The Courier
title: College Football: ONU rallies to stun No. 11 John Carroll
text:
Comment: 0 
UNIVERSITY HEIGHTS — Ohio Northern rallied with 17 unanswered points to top unbeaten No. 11 John Carroll 30-27 in an Ohio Athletic Conference football game on Saturday. Justin Magazine nearly tipped the century mark with 99 yards rushing and three total touchdowns to lead the Polar Bears rushing attack. Will Freed, despite four turnovers, led ONU’s aerial attack, tossing for 321 yards and two touchdowns, including the go-ahead 35-yard TD to Justin McCray with 4:22 remaining to propel the Polar Bears to victory. Ohio Northern improved to 3-1 overall, 2-1 in the OAC. John Carroll fell to 3-1, 2-1. Ohio Northern 0 7 13 10 — 30 John Carroll 10 7 10 0 — 27 First Quarter J — Howell 25 pass from Schaefer (Vivonetto kick) J — Vivonetto 31 FG J — James 5 pass from Schaefer (Vivonetto kick) ONU — Magazine 69 pass from Freed (DiMario kick) Third Quarter J — McKendick 35 INT return (Vivonetto kick) ONU — Magazine 1 run (kick failed) J — Vivonetto 39 FG ONU — Magazine 3 run (DiMario kick) Fourth Quarter ONU — McCray 35 pass from Freed (Chaney kick) 
BLUFFTON 56 HANOVER 10 HANOVER — Conner Sheehan tossed five touchdowns and Devante Thomas-Wright ran for another three as Bluffton shellacked Hanover 56-10 in a Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference game on Saturday. Sheehan finished with 198 yards on 13 of 22 passing, while Thomas-Wright totaled 96 yards on 14 carries. Micah Roberson was Sheehan’s favorite target, reeling in 11 passes for 132 yards and two TDs. Korbin Showalter also caught two scores for 61 yards for the Beavers. Dustin Fisher, despite no end zone trips, led Bluffton with 105 yards on 12 carries as it improved to 2-2 overall, 1-1 in HCAC.
